Class PalBook

  • java.lang.Object
    • PalBook

  • public class PalBook
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple social network with members who may or may not be pals. In this network, pals are bidirectional. That is, if A is the pal of B, then B is the pal of A (just like facebook but not like instagram).
    Author:
    Norm Krumpe, Manar Mohamed

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PalBook()
      Creates an empty PalBook social network, with no members, and a max size of 500.
      PalBook(int maxSize)
      Creates an empty PalBook social network, with no members, and a specified maximum size.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PalBook

        public PalBook()
        Creates an empty PalBook social network, with no members, and a max size of 500.

      • PalBook

        public PalBook(int maxSize)
        Creates an empty PalBook social network, with no members, and a specified maximum size.
        Parameters:
        maxSize - the maximum number of members for the network

    • Method Detail

      • getMemberCount

        public int getMemberCount()
        Gets a count of the number of members.
        Returns:
        the number of members in the social network

      • addMember

        public boolean addMember(java.lang.String id)
        Adds a member to the social network. Returns true if, at the end of the method, that member is in the network, and false otherwise. Note that if the member already exists in the network, the member will not be added a second time, and the method will return true to indicate that the member is in the network. The only reason this method should fail is if the social network has reached its maximum size.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the member to add. No two members may have the same id.
        Returns:
        true if the member is in the network at the completion of this method, and false if not.

      • getMembers

        public java.lang.String[] getMembers()
        Returns a (possibly empty) array of all members in the network, sorted by id.
        Returns:
        an array of all members in the network, sorted by id. Returns an array of length 0 if there are no members in the network.

      • getPals

        public java.lang.String[] getPals(java.lang.String id)
        Returns the pals of a particular member, sorted by id.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of a member
        Returns:
        an array of the pals of the specified member, sorted by id. Returns an array of size zero if the specified member does not exist, or if the member exists but has no pals.

      • commonPals

        public java.lang.String[] commonPals(java.lang.String id1,
                                     java.lang.String id2)
        Given two members, returns an array of members who are pals with both of the two members. The array will be sorted by the members' ids.
        Parameters:
        id1 - the id of one member
        id2 - the id of another (not necessarily different) member
        Returns:
        an array of members who are pals to both of the two specified members, sorted by id.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a newline-separated list of members, including a comma-separated list of each member's pals. Note that the list of members should be sorted by id, and each member's list of pals should be sorted by id. For example: Amy [Dina, Mary]
        Bob [Mary]
        Dina [Amy, Mary]
        Mary [Amy, Bob, Dina]
        Steve []
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A newline-separated list of members, with each member's pals. Members and pal lists sorted by id.

      • containsMember

        public boolean containsMember(java.lang.String id)
        Returns true if there exists a member in the network with the given id, and false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of a member
        Returns:
        true if the member exists in the network, and false otherwise

      • arePals

        public boolean arePals(java.lang.String id1,
                       java.lang.String id2)
        Returns true if the two specified people exist in the network, and are pals, and returns false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        id1 - the id of a person
        id2 - the id of another person
        Returns:
        true if id1 and id2 are pals in the network, and false otherwise

      • makePals

        public boolean makePals(java.lang.String id1,
                        java.lang.String id2)
        If id1 and id2 are members in the network, then makes them pals. Returns true if, at the end of the method, id1 and id2 are pals (which could mean they were pals before this method was invoked), and returns false otherwise (which really would only happen if id1 or id2 were not a member in the network.
        Parameters:
        id1 - the id of a person
        id2 - the id of another person
        Returns:
        true if id1 and id2 are pals in the network, and false otherwise.

      • endPals

        public void endPals(java.lang.String id1,
                    java.lang.String id2)
        Removes id1 from id2's pal list, and removes id2 from id1's pal list. Does nothing id1 or id2 are not members, or if they are members but are not pals.
        Parameters:
        id1 - the id of a person
        id2 - the id of another person

      • removeMember

        public void removeMember(java.lang.String id)
        Removes member from the social network. If member is pals with anyone, all traces of that member will be gone. That is, member will be removed from everyone's pal list. Does nothing if member is not in the social network.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the member to be removed
